(NYSE: RLGY), and the driving force behind inventive technology for brokers and agents affiliated with Realogy√¢s world renowned real estate brands. ZapLabs delivers its highly effective consumer, sales associate and broker solutions in support of Realogy√¢s leading franchise brands and is positioned to expand the scope of its technology development efforts to encompass Realogy√¢s other business segments, including residential brokerage, relocation and settlement services. ZapLabs is headquartered in Emeryville, California.
Senior DevOps/Site Reliability Engineer
ZapLabs is looking for a highly motivated Senior DevOps/Site Reliability engineer to help design and build a modern infrastructure√Ç for building, deploying, and monitoring high volume consumer facing web applications along with internal tools and systems. √Ç You√¢ll work on everything from transitioning a good chunk of our infrastructure to AWS, helping us move to a container-based service architecture, and supporting the √¢Big Data√¢ infrastructure used by our Data Science team. √Ç You should be passionate about engineering and operations (e.g. you read the Netflix and Airbnb engineering blogs with your morning coffee and have a copy of Google√¢s Site Reliability Engineering book on your bedside table) and excel at writing code to automate everything.
Here√¢s what we√¢d expect you to know:
Configuration management tools, preferably Chef. √Ç We have lots of servers and and need to manage them in an automated way.
AWS. √Ç Big part of the plan for the next six months is to move a lot of our infrastructure into AWS.
Continuous integration software, e.g. Jenkins or Bamboo
Advanced knowledge of UNIX/Linux systems administration
How to write good code (data structures, algorithms, etc.)
Expertise in designing, analyzing and troubleshooting large-scale distributed systems.
Be comfortable working in a highly collaborative environment
Have solid communication skills- verbal and written
And some other stuff that would give you a leg up:
Resource managers, e.g. Mesos, Kubernetes, Yarn, etc.
Docker√¢this is a big part of how we√¢re going to be able to scale services and give engineer the tools they need to produce and deploy them.
Distributed messaging systems, e.g. Kafka
√¢Big Data√¢ tools, e.g. Spark, Hive, HDFS
Note: Nothing in this job description restricts management√¢s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.

text:
Paid dental insurance
Paid health insurance
Paid parental leave
Retirement or pension contribution program
Unlimited paid holidays
We‚Äôre looking for a Site Reliability Engineer to join the SRE team at Zapier. Zapier‚Äôs on a mission to make everyone more productive at work. Over 3 million professionals already use Zapier to save more time, but there are millions more to reach. As a member of the Zapier SRE team, you‚Äôll write code and engineer systems to allow us to scale task processing for millions of customers and enable engineering teams to ship hundreds of times a day without fear!
If you‚Äôre interested in launching your career at a fast-growing and profitable startup, then read on‚Ä¶
About You
You‚Äôre a skilled Site Reliability Engineer. We‚Äôre looking for 3-5 years of experience in practicing infrastructure as code with Ansible and Terraform, working with Kubernetes clusters and implementing high availability / resilience patterns at scale, and writing programs in Golang and Python.
You‚Äôre an excellent written communicator. We‚Äôre also a 100% remote team, and writing is our primary means of communication at Zapier.
You believe relationships are critical to success. The SRE team interact with every other engineering team in the organization and maintaining great relationships and communicating effectively with those teams on a regular basis is a key to success.
You‚Äôre an expert at diagnosing performance issues. Keeping zapier running efficiently is a main part of this role, so being able to diagnose the cause of slow downs on task processing to the root cause and tune the performance issue goes a long way.
Things You‚Äôll Do
Infrastructure automation on EC2 with ansible, packer and terraform
Write programs in golang and python to automate the manual processes and increase reliability.
Enable teams to ship faster by providing self-service tooling to work effectively with Kubernetes
Implement high availability / resilience patterns to handle surges in traffic and task processing load
Level up our continuous delivery to continue to enable engineering teams to ship features hundreds of times a day without fail
Have an enormous impact working closely with teams across the organization
As a part of our All Hands Support initiative, help customers have the best possible experience with Zapier
About Zapier
Zapier helps people across the world automate the boring and tedious parts of their job. We do that by helping everyone connect the web applications they already use and love.
We believe that there are jobs a computer is best at doing and that there are jobs a human is best at doing. We want to empower businesses to create processes and systems that let computers do what they are best at doing and let humans do what they are best at doing.
We believe that with the right tools, you can have big impact with less hassle.
We believe in small teams. Small teams are fast and nimble. Small teams mean less bureaucracy and less management and more getting things done.
We believe in a safe, welcoming, and inclusive environment. All teammates at Zapier agree to a code of conduct.
The Whole Package
Location: Planet Earth
Our distributed environment lets us work with the best people. You don‚Äôt have to be located in the USA either. Some team members live in the United Kingdom, Thailand, India, Nigeria, Taiwan, Guatemala, New Zealand, Australia, and more! You just need the skills and drive to succeed in this role and the ability to work from anywhere.
Compensation:
Competitive salary (we don‚Äôt use remote as an excuse to pay less)
Great healthcare + dental + vision coverage Retirement plan with 4% company match
Profit-sharing
2 annual company retreats to awesome places
14 weeks paid leave for new parents of biological or adopted children
Pick your own equipment. We‚Äôll set you up with whatever Apple laptop + monitor combo you want plus any software you need.
Unlimited vacation policy. Plus we require you to take at least 2 weeks off each year. We see most employees take 4-5 weeks off per year. This isn‚Äôt a vague policy where unlimited vacation means no vacation.
Work with awesome companies around the world. We partner with great software companies all over the world and you‚Äôll constantly get to interact with people from these great companies *While we take care of our international folks as best we can, currently, healthcare and retirement plans are only available to US-based employees.
How to Apply
We have a non-standard application process. To jump-start the process we ask a few questions we normally would ask at the start of an interview. This helps speed up the process and lets us get to know you a bit better right out of the gate. Please make sure to answer each question. After you apply, you are going to hear back from us, even if we don‚Äôt seem like a good fit. In fact, throughout the process, we strive to make sure you never go more than seven days without hearing from us.
Optional: Share anonymously some demographic information about yourself to help us better track trends related to the backgrounds of candidates interested in working at Zapier in order for us to build a team that represents the users at Zapier and the broader world population.

text:
Kesson Group Albania sh.p.k.
is a software development company based in Tirana that caters exclusively to two Canadian companies; Teach Away Inc. and Skooli Online Tutoring.
Job Position: DevOps / Site Reliability Engineer (SRE)
Job Location: Tirana, Albania
Skooli is seeking a Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) to join our growing team! This individual will be responsible for maintaining and evolving our automated CI/CD infrastructure.
We believe deeply in the power of education and making an impact on the future leaders of the world. If you are eager to play a key role in a fast-paced, education startup we are interested in hearing from you.
Who are we?
Skooli is a focused, energetic group of people that are really excited about how technology can improve education. We like to solve challenging educational problems, and have fun doing it! Our online tutoring solution and interactive online classroom allow teachers and students to connect in a secure digital space with video conferencing, online chat, document sharing, and an interactive whiteboard. We are an early stage team poised for large growth. We believe in accessible education, and want to help every student reach their full potential.
Who are you?
You are the DevOps specialist concentrated at ensuring stable performance and uninterrupted availability of high-load apps across large-scale systems.
SRE is also a mindset and a set of engineering approaches to running better production systems by promoting continuous innovation.
Role Responsibilities
Engage in and improve the whole lifecycle of services‚Äîfrom inception and design, through deployment, operation and refinement.
Support services before they go live through activities such as local development environment setup, integration and testing environment setup and monitoring, capacity and release planning
Maintain services once they are live by measuring and monitoring availability, latency and overall system health.
Scale systems sustainably through mechanisms like automation, and promote continuous innovation of systems by pushing for changes that improve performance and reliability.
Work as an integral member of an Agile team through participating in technical discussions, planning and blameless retrospectives.
Pair with other SRE/SAs, mentor junior staff

AWS
Kubernetes
Kops
Terraform
Cloud Formation
Docker
Git

ElastiCache
Jenkins
Grafana
Kibana

A degree in Computer Science or related field or equivalent experience
5+ years of Software Eng/DevOps experience
Experience in one or more of the following: bash, Python, Go, Perl or Ruby.
Proficient knowledge of Git
Solid understanding of containers and virtualization.
Proficient understanding of OWASP security principles
Previous experience with AWS or similar
It would be great if you also had:
Experience working in an Agile team environment
Experience working with Kubernetes and IAC
Understanding of ‚Äúsession management‚Äù in a distributed server environment
Previous experience with caching technologies (memcacheD, redis, Varnish, AWS CloudFront)
Working knowledge of WebRTC

As part of a broader team of engineers and administrators you will have front-to-back engineering and management ownership for tools and infrastructure used across the company. Depending on your assigned primary focus within the team, this may include systems like AWS, Firewalls, VPN, Confluence, Splunk, Jenkins and other systems.
You will be integral to new releases/upgrades, monitoring their status and working closely with engineers to diagnose and troubleshoot issues. Further responsibilities include access control, capacity management (scaling) and firewall rule management as well as keeping systems patched, up-to-date and available according to our operational and security requirements, while participating in an on-call roster.
To support the automation of all tasks, engineering ad-hoc tools and systems will be a key duty. This role requires you to collaborate with developers to ensure application components produced are compatible and optimised in our production environment and ensure proper workflow tracking (Jira) and documentation (Confluence)

About the company
JustWatch is an...
text:
Site Reliability Engineer at JustWatch GmbH
üá©üá™ Germany ‚Ä∫ Berlin
About the company
JustWatch is an international movie marketing startup based in Berlin. It was founded in October 2014 by an experienced and successful team with a track record in marketing, product and AdTech.
Talent is and always will be our highest priority. We provide an intense learning culture with high degrees of autonomy and lots of room for personal growth to achieve excellence.
Our core values ‚ÄúLearn and Deliver Value‚Äù are the foundation of JustWatch and the basis for all major decisions.
Salary
Negotiable
Job description
JustWatch is an international movie marketing startup based in Berlin. Founded in October 2014 by an experienced and successful team with world-class knowledge in marketing, product and AdTech we are constantly looking for passionate people to join our mission.
JustWatch offers data-driven movie marketing for the film industry. Based on user data from justwatch.com and our apps - by now the largest streaming search engine worldwide - we run data-driven digital marketing campaigns for Hollywood‚Äôs latest blockbusters as well as for independent movies.
Who we are looking for:
Curiosity, drive and passion are shared characteristics of all people at JustWatch and we are looking for these values in every person we are hiring. We only want people who are willing to constantly learn through challenging themselves and others. All of us also love to get things done and strongly believe in ‚Äúdone is better than perfect‚Äù. Dedication to software craftsmanship and a drive for elegant and simple solutions come in a close second.
In addition, for this particular role we are looking for:
‚Ä¢ Smart people with a desire to ship
‚Ä¢ At least a few months of deep familiarity of the Go(lang) language
‚Ä¢ Skills around the linux command line including basic networking and web technologies
‚Ä¢ Experience with some SQL and NoSQL data stores
‚Ä¢ Basic knowledge of active and passive security measures and cryptography
‚Ä¢ Initial experience about data structures and primitives of distributed systems
‚Ä¢ Ability and desire to work with cutting edge container and cluster technology
‚Ä¢ Fluent in English, ability to work onsite in Berlin
Your responsibilities:
‚Ä¢ You will continuously improve developer experience with fast builds, quick (canary) deployments and ChatOps
‚Ä¢ You will care about great metrics and sane alerting at a low false-positive rate
‚Ä¢ You will make distributed systems reliable, fault tolerant and highly available
‚Ä¢ You will build immutable infrastructure based on the 12factor methodology, incorporating cluster, configuration and credentials management
‚Ä¢ You will help set up, maintain, debug and optimize different data stores (PostgreSQL, ElasticSearch, Redshift, Aerospike)
‚Ä¢ You will write lots of software too, always striving for the highest level of automatization and sharpening your engineering skills
‚Ä¢ You will orchestrate dozens of internal and external services and keep them fast and secure
‚Ä¢ You will be available to share pager duty for the rare instances of something serious happening
Our promise:
‚Ä¢ You will become part of a passionate, professional and friendly team while getting first-hand experience in building a world-leading tech company
‚Ä¢ A steep learning curve: You will work directly with Christoph and his team, who are leading experts in systems design, infrastructure operations and site reliability engineering.
‚Ä¢ A challenging environment with an open feedback culture and a strong focus on personal development
‚Ä¢ Lots of room for personal development, freedom and responsibility
‚Ä¢ You will have access to an experienced founder team with an international track record in building successful tech companies
Sounds like you? Great, we‚Äôd like to meet you. Just send us a short mail that gives us an idea of what motivates you, why you want to work at JustWatch and how you think you will help us to achieve our goals. We are not interested in a perfect CV, or letters of recommendation. We just want to know who you are and who you want to become!
Apply now!

name: Platform/Site Reliability Engineer
summary: Maersk, the world's largest shipping company, is transforming into an industrial digital giant that ...
text:
Maersk, the world's largest shipping company, is transforming into an industrial digital giant that enables global trade with its land, sea and port assets. We are the digital and software development organisation that builds products in the areas of predictive science (forecasting, customer and market analytics), optimization and IoT. This position offers the opportunity to build your engineering career in a data and analytics intensive environment, delivering work that has direct and significant impact on the success of our company.
Maersk's Technology organisation is a practitioner of the microservices approach to software development. Our nascent production ecosystem is based around sets of interdependent services. Our team's mission is to build and maintain a digital platform enabling lower friction when developing in a service-oriented architecture through the use of cloud computing, infrastructure-as-code and container technologies like Docker/Kubernetes. We want to make development and operations in a microservice-oriented environment an efficient and pleasant experience.
This is an extremely exciting time to join a fast paced, growing and dynamic team that solves some of the toughest problems in the industry, and builds the future of trade & logistics.
A.P. Moller - Maersk maintains a strong focus on career development, and strong team members regularly have broad possibilities to expand their skill set and impact in an environment characterised by change and continuous progress
At Maersk we value the diversity of our talent and will always strive to recruit the best person for the job ‚Äì we value diversity in all its forms, including but not limited to: gender, age, nationality, race, sexual orientation, disability or religious beliefs. We are proud of our diversity and see it as a genuine source of strength for building high performing teams.
As a SRE / Platform Engineer, you will participate in delivering products that directly impact our business, with strong support from fellow dedicated team members, and drive digital transformation at one of the largest companies in the world.
You should feel at home working in and around a wide range of technologies and platforms, and empathies with the day-to-day bottlenecks and challenges of development work and operations.
You enjoy building new systems from a blank slate as much as you love monitoring and tweaking existing systems to achieve maximum performance, while automating everything on your way.
Your responsibilities will be to:
‚Ä¢ Be embedded in cross-functional product teams to enable our software to get quickly and securely into production with fast, agile iterations.
‚Ä¢ Drive application performance, scalability, security, and reliability through continuous deployment, monitoring, logging, alerting and automation in the entire lifecycle of the product (inception, design, through development and operationalization)
‚Ä¢ Take part in on-call rotations with the product team, and take the lead in preventing incidents and maintaining product SLAs, through automation and blameless postmortems
‚Ä¢ Build and maintain cloud deployments through infrastructure-as-code.
‚Ä¢ Keep up with the cutting edge in relevant technologies, and drive implementation of new solutions.
‚Ä¢ More than 3 years of industry experience within SRE roles or platform or software engineering, ideally in a data / analytics intensive company
‚Ä¢ An ideal candidate would have deep knowledge of building and operating Kubernetes based and server less workloads, and deploying and operating cloud-based services (as infrastructure as code)
‚Ä¢ Excellent track record of improving and running software through data and automation.
‚Ä¢ Experience with monitoring, APM, logging and alerting products like ELK, Grafana, Datadog, PagerDuty or equivalent
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with Agile / Scrum practices; proficient in git, testing paradigms, pair programming and DevOps principles.
‚Ä¢ Experience with Continuous Integration and Deployment (Jenkins, Travis, CircleCI, Drone or equivalent).
‚Ä¢ Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or relevant technical experience
‚Ä¢ Experience with operating and optimizing applications written in one or more of the following languages: Python, Java, JavaScript, and Go.
‚Ä¢ Track record of writing SRE tooling in bash and one or more of the following: Python, Java, JavaScript, and Go.
‚Ä¢ Fluent proficiency in both written and oral English

text:
Grubhub is changing the way we get work done. We‚Äôre assembled into small, entrepreneurial type of teams that are designed to be self-sufficient. As a Site Reliability Engineer on one of these teams, it‚Äôs our job to provide the supporting infrastructure, infrastructure automation as well as systems design knowledge to the team. You‚Äôll be supporting your team‚Äôs development, pre-production and production environments.
Our SREs particiapte in stand-up and sprint planning meetings, while also spending 20% of their on common systems related projects. .
Desired Skills and Experience
Create, maintain, own and operate your team‚Äôs services that supporting fundamental capabilities within Grubhub‚Äôs products.
Tackle some of the most challenging problems you can face developing high availability services in a distributed cloud environment that needs to scale exponentially.
Help evaluate and choose emerging technologies‚Ä¶new service protocols and architectures, self-healing capabilities, globally distributed caching, performance and code quality tooling, etc. Determine the right tool for the right task.
Manage / Lead a team of 2 to 3 direct reports
Java for micro services
Cassandra
Docker (in production!)
Mesos and Marathon for job scheduling
Combination of AWS and our own hardware
Python and Fabric for automation and our CD pipeline
Jenkins for builds and task execution
Linux (CentOS and Ubuntu)

Puppet
Experience building complex distributed systems. In this role you are the one gravitating toward operational concerns of the team, focusing on reliability, performance, capacity planning and automation of everything.
Proficient in high level script languages such as Python or Ruby (Python preferred)
Experience developing solutions leveraging Docker
Experience managing Linux (Centos, Ubuntu) systems
Configuration management experience with Puppet, Chef, or Ansible
Building/implementing monitoring for network, server and application status
Experience with monitoring tools such as graphite, nagios, Datadog, Runscope
Experience with log aggregation systems using splunk, logstash, loggly, elasticsearch
Continuous integration, testing, and deployment using git, jenkins
Experience with relational databases (MySQL)
Experience with NoSQL databases (Cassandra, Couchbase, Mongo)
Experience with Hadoop (Cloudera, DataStax), mahout and other big data platforms
Exceptional communication and troubleshooting skills.
